ZLTI2ZsKkE2a0bMnVoBhyA.text: Absolutely. Fast, well-priced, and generally tasty. Judgement based on large pepper-steak, and their best-selling 1.15 pound scotch pie. Pepper steak is juicy *and* peppery, and comes with a decent crust. I may be slightly biased by deprivation of such pastries in central Germany.  Not much seating in the store-front, although you would want to savor them inside since they'll get cold quickly out.

Xfpw5rBbKpA18UrFhy2sOA.text: The Traditional Pasty was delicious! Meat, peas, potatoes, carrots- yum! And it was only around 2 :) we didn't try any of the others, but they sounded good.

6zAn7pyn0jvFsFG8jKe45g.text: Fantastic meat pie! They were about to close and I had enough time to pick up the NY Steak Pie. It's huge and was the perfect late night snack for a long days of walking around Scotland looking at Castles and being a tourist . The shop is small so it's for pickup and carry only. They have a huge selection of meat pies that come in moon shape as well as your typical pie shape. Close to closing time they will run out of pies. I really wanted to try the haggis pie , which has haggis and a layer of potatoes and turnips baked with it aka tatties and nips!

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. NY Steak Pie

hhv9WG_s3-wLnErMBc8dOw.text: Delicious and cheap! Perfect for lunch on the go. I was sad that I discovered this place my last day in Edinburgh. Definitely a place I would frequent if I lived near by.

Olr-fv1FPxQBDrHFvBquzA.text: That rare combination of good, fast and cheap, these people do one thing and do it very well.   I mean, one pound for a macaroni-and-cheese pie simply can't be argued. A pound and a half for a large Cornish pasty that's still crisp and flaky?   It's the True opposite of health food, but you knew that when you clicked the word 'pie shop', now, didn't you?   My one regret is that it's quite filling, which means I'd run out of steam before the end of my second hand-sized pie.   I'm not local, so my filter for 'health food' might be a bit off, but this definitely isn't somewhere you can eat frequently unless you're also training for a marathon or something.

vCHb_ODGhPAx8VWrsRMzzQ.text: It's cheap, it's delicious, it's fast and the selection is mindblowing. I would really have liked to shrink Piemaker and put it in my pocket so I could take it home.  I love pies. Little hand-held things with a flaky crust and delicious things wrapped inside it, hot and filling - I could probably eat them for every meal if it didn't mean gaining 20lbs. Piemaker delivers in spades. All pies are under 2 and the variety is huge. Their cheeseburgers are also nothing to sneer at. Comfort food at its best.

Jl7JBgD6em29BD6KMveQkw.text: Solid 3.5 stars. The pies were very hit and miss, but the majority of them are very, very decent. My favorites were the scotch pie and the mac n' cheese pie. They had so many to choose from that it's hard to try them all in one go! There were ones with haggis, vegetarian selections, and more. My husband tried one that was a hotdog wrapped in essentially tater tots. I was not impressed. Neither was he. HOWEVER, the meat and veggie pies were really delicious and the crusts were flaky so overall WIN. You can't beat the prices either. If you're in vacationing on a budget, you'd be a fool not to come here for some seriously decent food on the cheap.

d_L4vX3bd0EtC90I-YYI7Q.text: This quaint little place specializes in quick and inexpensive pies. They have a large selection of meat pies and I tried the Traditional pie, which had minced meat with onions, carrots, and other veggies. The pie crust was buttery, flaky, and delicious. The filling was so so and a bit on the bland side. I would definitely return to try other flavors. Also, they were out of sweet pies when we went, which was disappointing.

NFgkaFdYmiTMZTNhZS0KwA.text: I'm not an expert on how meat pies should taste. I know nothing about the consistency of of the shell should be or what traditional pie really means. All I know is that this place is where I fulfilled my desire for pies. They have almost any pie you can name, from savoury to sweet, traditional to  innovative, meat to vegetarian all for cheap cheap cheap. With each pie at approximately 1.3, you can try as many pies as your heart desires. I wish my stomach was as big as my eyes.  Stop by, say hi to the friendly workers, get some pie on the go, or sit at the bar stools, and eat until you're sick of pies!!

fSLE0I5EtT7OHYvsj3TaJA.text: The Scotch pie was wow!  packed with flavour. We also got a sausage roll which was good. The macaroni tart was just okay.

e0rJ72cLRkW8D7Ci6wosOw.text: Well pie maker doesn't need an exhaustive review given their name in Edinburgh for pies. They have variety but I can eat only veg over here my favourite is Moroccan vegetables pie and apple pie.

TdwKhvwjtzfqpV2GJzfARQ.text: Wanted simple take away on my last night in Edinburgh and decided to give this place a try. All I can say is wow. I had a fantastic dinner for three pounds, including s bottle of water and a homemade double chocolate donut. I strongly recommend the Scotch pie - it will change your life.

rZNGXH4Dv6Q_uQe9gF6Z0w.text: The Piemaker is simply a great pie shop, with a diverse range of both savory (meat based and veggie options) and sweet pies. The best bit is the price is good (a little more than Greggs for a better pie) meaning that on a winters day a warm pie is a no-brainer as opposed to a sandwich.  They open at 9 and offer bacon rolls alongside the pies for breakfast and close at 8 on a weekday (a bit later on the weekend), so if you want some late-ish food that hasn't been fried the Piemaker is a good choice.  Overall I am a fan, cheap freshly baked pies, what's not to like!

59CB5sQfA_CNHbBwQHAbBA.text: Easy accessible location, especially if you've been shopping by Princes Street.  Prices are cheap, for decent quality pies, I've not found it phenomenal but it was enjoyable nonetheless.  Doesn't have a lot of seating spaces, so I wouldn't recommend for groups...  A place for a quick bite or perhaps takeaway

bC75TN2InKOLfIuXaOM8wA.text: Original Scotch Pie. Traditional Pasty. Chicken and Mushroom. Raspberry and Rhubarb Cake. Most excellent!

SkTT6P8OBry7U-1YiJgRRg.text: So many pies, so cheap, so good. Our band's favorite spot in Edinburgh. If you're down for it, you can fill your belly for under 2. Highly recommended. Vegetarian, vegan and 'healthy' options as well.

Wo-0BSJ49CoOQvon2KeQdw.text: During our week long stay in Edinburgh our band had breakfast here every day. Affordable, filling and great service. Very limited seating so having a sit down meal with all your mates might be out of the question but the best grab & go food. I tried just about every item from the menu and I honestly can't pick a favorite. They were all great!

ZLPSP5FYoTATSSQJ9mIw1A.text: Why anyone would visit Greggs (or "F**king Awful" as I like to call it) after visiting Piemaker, I don't know.  Piemaker proves once and for all that pies not just have to be greasy, fatty, prosthetic pastry packets of meat slop. No indeedy not, Piemaker offers fresh, creative pies using good ingredients. It offers a range of vegetarian pies too, for a mere pittance. Okay so the food can still be a touch on the salty side, but the difference between this place and Greggs or even the popular Auld Jock's Pie Shoppe (which don't get me wrong is still decent), is quite something. Maybe I've always just got unlucky in these other places, but Piemaker really does offer good quality snack food for cheap.  I used to pop into Piemaker on my way back from the gym when I lived in London Road. To make the long journey more pleasant I would pop in and order, very often, the mushroom pie. Scrumptious!  So when I think about it, maybe my admiration for Piemaker stems more from my dislike of similar places, which sort of lowers the standards. Either way it offers a great lunchtime or snack alternative.  Recommended!

qIBhzFDieLYHnIoUaLMayA.text: Piemaker is one of my favourite places to go for lunch in Edinburgh.  It's cheap, easy, has more than enough in the way of choice and always offers something tasty.  They do a huge range of pies, from mine and onion to their special Tikka Masala as well as assorted sweet ones.   Their sausage rolls are also great with nice fluffy pastry and good quality meat for the filling.  All their pies cost only 1.70 which is an amazing deal considering the quality.  I usually go for a chicken and ham pie along with a sausage roll which provides a tasty, filling lunch every time. I really couldn't fault Piemaker as it offers top food and quick, friendly service to match.

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

45JTXuf9_GyIqNA4OPq7IQ.text: The pie maker wins some cool points for the fact that it's built over the Edinburgh Dungeons!   Otherwise, the pie I had there was quite mediocre and I feel I need to have venture back there and give them another chance. For one, their menu is so impressive, it wouldn't be fair to judge based on just one experience. Aside from pies, they also serve a variety of smoothies, baguettes and hot subs which look really appetising!   The counter initially is quite reminiscent of another favourite of mine, Greggs. However, it's obvious they've got a little sumn sumn going on in the back as well, to be able to provide all they serve on the menu! Super cheap, and a nice place to just grab a bite on the run.

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

gNyqzVpiAZeDzgyFdLrKaA.text: Yum! I love savory pies, and these are delicious. The perfect cheap lunch or snack in central Edinburgh.

lpEYfOmGem9ztFgFOvTr1g.text: When in Scotland, eat meat pies.    My husband and I each had a meat pie (steak & ale for him, steak & veggies for me) and two bottled sodas, plus we split an apple pie for dessert, and our total bill was under 12 pounds.  Delicious food, great value.

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. When in Scotland, eat meat pies.

nLINvM7ct4TI8B4tqzgxFQ.text: Edinburgh pies! Quick service even though it was busy with the Edinburgh festival. I shall return!

0osDt6ODhVcGpn4KRo0y3g.text: I did used to enjoy Piemaker and would often step in for a quick bite if I happened to be hungry while walking around Edinburgh, but a few years ago I swore off the place when I bit into a mince pie that contained apparently nothing but a cup of pure grease and a small turd of processed meat. It was a grotesque scene. I took a chomp, grease and puss just pored out onto the counter followed by a splat of pink.  I dropped the rest of it (a greasy pie casing), left, and never went back.  Piemaker could benefit from being more like an old-timey baker shop and less like a Greggs, the fact that they COULD do better is the only reason I am giving them 2/5 instead of 1/5.

GImhPzbBCuoa2h9AqpOxIA.text: Highly recommended! Nothing is better than a hot and tasty pie at cold raining day! Honestly don't know which pie to recommend because every pie is worth to try! Friendly owner and cozy store, no much space to sit so take one with you to the nearest park would be a great alternate.

FwBdTfLh9IQWGTAN_VD11A.text: Not a place that you'd think it but actually a good selection of vegetarian and even vegan pies. The staff are helpful and know what's in everything so can help with allergies and other dislikes. A great place for either a snack or a light lunch.  There isn't really proper seating other than a few bar stools at the window but grab your food take it to Hunter Square and watch a street performer in the sunshine.   Also they still proudly serve macaroni pies if you like that sort of thing...

uyTVzeYMl0WsNQNmxdwmKA.text: You can get such fresh and good pies. Lot of choices! And they all cost super cheap! Got a cheese and onion pie which was super cheesy and yummy for only 1.40!

Ln83-stkanahHKhPlMbO6Q.text: I LOVE this place!!  The pies are delicious and there's plenty of options to choose from, and it's SO affordable. This is my favorite shop to stop in to for a quick snack or a meal, hands-down. The staff are really friendly and don't make me feel uncomfortable when I have a hard time deciding what I want (like every time), and (contrary to what some other reviews say) there is usually enough space to sit and enjoy your food if you've stopped in on your own or with a friend. (Not family-sized, but so great as a little stop-in.)  What more is there to say? The food is served hot and it's absolutely delicious--definitely worth stopping by, especially on a cold, wet day. Comfort food at its best.

66a3gUnzG5YdyAGcwyMlZQ.text: It is what it is a pie shop, and it just so happens to be inexpensive, centrally located and great. I don't think there are many food items that us Scots don't turn into a pie at some point and Piemaker is no exception with its haggis, curry, lasagne etc offerings. This is our mid point after work booze session place. You finished work didn't have dinner and now the evening has some legs on it, so this is where you head.  Plus points - inexpensive - friendly staff - good food, in a few pints in drunken way (I have never eaten here sober)  - seems to be open latish - veggies are well catered for  Minus ..... I don't have any.

oh7aO_UKqthjpYIgrCsm-A.text: Food for a Fiver list: I don't think anything here is more than 5 pounds -  Pros: Good variety, good prices, always convenient  Cons: Cash only, nothing healthy, small place means really just take away  Even though it's 3 vs 3, I feel like the pros matter more than the cons. So just know to bring cash & the rest of it, it's a solid place

8BgBCwXCHf816RL1FjecSw.text: I think this is my favorite place to go for a quick and cheap lunch. This is also where I had some friends first try haggis so it has a special place in my heart. Sometimes they run out of certain pies later in the day, so I would suggest going earlier if you want a specific pie or roll. My favorite is the haggis/turnip/potato pie. Mmmm. Great spot to pop in on a cold day.

tPWwwPuSDZS7LPwHLuBt9A.text: Quick and cheap for a supper after a night out.  Nice that they have a veggie option and I had the macaroni pie.    They are all hot and ready to go and the pie maker is right across from my bus stop home, great!

UCYtkYGuPasiS3L9DBHbQA.text: Awesome meat pies and sausage rolls and at very reasonable prices. Definitely a must stop when in Edinburgh

ul4ho5Vy6L96dXTkiNRNAQ.text: I love meat in pies and this place has them. Awesooooooooome. The Mac and cheese pie is very good. Yummmmmy....

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

dyFUWiuaklrY7sPKn5hpiQ.text: Oh Mr. Pie Maker, you really know how to do it don't you?  Great selection. Even more awesome prices! Sadly, not many places to sit. On the rare occasion that it's a perfect day outside, it makes it nice to grab a pie and sit in a park to enjoy the weather.

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis pie with a mashed potato topping.
Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Perfectly flakey pie.

4wdZVhrSefKPB91irnqfMA.text: A Scotch pie for 1.20?? What's not to love about this place! When you're in the mood for a small, savory, and guiltily greasy meal, stop by the Piemaker. It's quick, delicious, and well worth the price. I would definitely come back here for takeaway - I've already got my eye on the macaroni and cheese pie.

DAiBcvEWWsgMiu6u7wnLgw.text: This is a small hole in the wall place right off South Bridge Street.  They have very little seating at the front door, possibly enough room for six or so people Max.   They serve all kinds of pies and rolls.   Both sweet and savory, what ever tickles your fancy.    I have stopped in here a couple of times.  The staff are super friendly and helpful when I am questioning them and asking for their opinions.   I have to say their Scotch pie is my favorite.  It is some kind of minced meat pie that looks like a mini quiche.   The savory pies are like a mixture of a pot pie and a hot pocket, for those folks from the states.   These are like I would imagine Sweeney Todd made minus the human part.   The pies have a great flaky light crust  like a puff pastry.  Truly melts in your mouth.    The price is super cheap.  So for a pound or two you get to have a great portable lunch.  I really wish they had these in the states.    Stop in if passing and grab you a few to go.   They even have some vegetarian and vegan pies.  If you aren't hungry at the time you are passing...They sell them frozen as well so you can take them home to enjoy.

WOj0nzi0pXOFpTWGD89TpA.text: The crust was a little tough but it was still delicious! The haggis pie was yummy and the black current turnover was amazing!

FOr5r8vvm1eMnfuwjZ46oA.text: The Piemaker is the perfect place to sample local flavor, especially if you're pence pinching. The two most popular pies, the sausage roll and the Scotch pie, also happen to be the cheapest. They will you run you for about 60 and 90 pence respectively. They have a larger assortment of calzone-shaped pies on the back counter. I tried the hot pepper steak and the sausage roll - both with a can of soda cost only 3.60. The meat was tender and flavorful and the buttery crusts were flakey. It was like eating a gourmet Hot Pocket (no offense, because I love Hot Pockets). The meat and potato pie is served as a more traditional double-crust meat pie and is just as tasty. This is a great place for a quick bite if you're in a hurry. I would definitely come back, just to try all the other pie filling flavors!

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Hot pepper steak pie (back); sausage roll (front)

dUqK3-nMDfd5dP5e0ii91A.text: Ahhhhh! It's one of my favorite places in Edinburgh!!! I've been here for several times, and you'll never be disappointed by the vintage cottage pie - with creamy, rich baked potato and juicy beef mince in it. It tastes so good that I always order this one when I go to Piemaker. I usually wait about 5 mins because every time I go there, the vintage cottage is sold out - see how popular it is? The pie there is also very cheap - with 1.5 pounds you can get stuffed!

rdhk1Vs6pnAw-fTa5l3Hng.text: Great dine-in or takeaway place with filling food, and relatively cheap. Small shop so grab a spot at the window and do some people watching, then mosey on and don't linger (sorry to the folks standing behind me that wanted the seat!). Or, grab a pie and head out on the street ... great options, hot and ready to go.

9gUBJi2SyEnmiknRhplCMg.text: You cant get much better than a 90p sausage roll. I also had the scotch pie and it was so good. I went back multiple times during my trip. Great on a cold Scottish day.

QCnsXM89UB2gd9wTIN4_Bg.text: Unbeatable prices. Most pies are under 2 pounds, and are super filling! I especially liked the vintage cottage pie (which I believe was potatoes atop meat with a beautifully made crust). We didn't love the traditional Scotch pie as much, but there's at least ten different pies to choose from. Not much seating, but totally hit the spot.

Zj-rlrFX9z-BXZvVXQ3oGA.text: Not bad for fast food pies. The haggis roll was quite good; the meat pies were just okay.

4KPEdG-TykvfvjBUzXeTRw.text: Nice selection of savory and sweet pies. Tried several pies and the steak pie was our favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Macaroni pie
Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Inside meat and veggie pie
Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Inside Scottish meat pie

tVEw5PgJu-ZBN442abI53w.text: Fabulous pies! Full of flavor and a great deal. Definitely need to stop in for a freshly baked pie! (Apple turnover was delicious as well)

wLrrQJ-sIdqzDVXD9l07ww.text: Flakiest crust I've ever tasted! My chicken and veg pie was a bit doughy, but the filling had a great consistency. Could've used a bit more salt. The beef pie had really amazing flavor but could've been cooked longer - it almost had the texture of raw meat. Very tender, though.   I wish they'd had the haggis or traditional scotch pies! Those are the ones I really wanted to try. I'll be back again this week to pick some up.   Cute setup, and points for reheating the pies before serving.

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicken and veg pie
Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chunky veg pie

sUYsqVA3mQsRYs1lYbJiVQ.text: It's been something like four years since the last time I was here, and yet I still remember the bacon baps. In fact, the only reason I'm even writing this is because I was talking about some of my favorite places in Edinburgh, and while there's some much "nicer" food spots that I remember, the first thing I will always think of are the bacon baps.  My wife (girlfriend at the time) and I stopped in here for a light lunch, and were somewhat limited by the fact that they only took cash and we only had a few quid on us. However, we had enough for a two bacon baps, and they were fantastic. We sat down, ate, and went on our way.  After a few minutes of walking, I rerouted us back to the apartment to grab more cash so that I could go back and get another sandwich. The people working laughed a little bit, and then loaded it up with around twice the usual quantity of bacon. I was ok with this.  It ruined the "light" part of lunch, but I'll remember this place fondly forever, and always try to stop back in when I'm in Edinburgh.

ufgr_MCEmoQHs7FkW5wbBg.text: Good crust, SUPER cheap (6.45) for five pies and a soda, and great fillings. I got the sausage roll, pizza roll, Scotch pie, and Mac and cheese pie. I prefer a pork sausage but the beef sausage in the sausage roll was okay. Especially good was the pizza roll! Hit the spot.

yhPOCZ42Coe6Xxvr6hLZRA.text: There isn't a great deal more to say about The Piemaker. It's kinda all in the name. They make pies.   But not just any old pies! Yes, they have a vast range of pies. Vast! They also have VEGAN PIES!! And not just one or two vegan pies. They normally have a SELECTION OF VEGAN PIES!!!   Now, pies are not gourmet food. Pies are for when you want a quick, low-priced, warming, portable snack. Which quite a lot of people often do, so it's normally busy. The staff are remarkably efficient and amazingly cheery. I think it's because they are making so many people happy through the medium of pies.  I've been here a few times, but sadly any further detail escapes me. I'm normally just so giddy with excitement at the prospect of a vegan pie. And it's quite possible that I may have had a few beers by this point in proceedings. The only other notable feature is that there's normally quite a lot of flaky pastry on the floor, scattered by drunk pie-munchers. And that the punters tend to be very very happy with having a pie.  That's it. Did I mention there's pies?

Xgtf1TX-BDALmUCkFa5NVA.text: ***MY GO-TO SPOT FOR EVERY CHEAP, DELICIOUS BREAKFAST IN EDINBURGH***  Or, for that matter, any meal of the day.  The pie maker makes rich, flavorful, tantalizing meat and cheese and sauce pies for absolutely dirt cheap.  You can get their sausage rolls for a mere 80 pence and pizza rolls for the same.  Try the macaroni and cheese pie if want to transport yourself to whole other world of gastro goodness.  The place is situated just off the main tourist drag off of Royal Mile which means it's rarely swarming with people.  And as a world traveler who lives on a budget, I'm come to rely on this institution as a pillar or my low cost travel diet.  Do yourself a favor and stop in! Highly recommended.

6d749bJkBeZk-D0n3JtDfw.text: The absolute best. Super cheap and super yummy. All the pies are under 3 (most under 2) and there is a flavor for everyone! My partner and I got 5 pies to share and we were not disappointed in our choices. Their savory flavors are good but my favorite was the apple raspberry turnover. They offered to heat up our pies before serving them to us. Not much seating here so plan to get your food to go when it's busy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

xiP0IPZplKeeSEetl_k05A.text: Tasty, tasty treats!  Wish it was in my neighborhood in California!  Lovely lady at the counter!  Thank you!

7ikPZ1tNdMLunP_8DJWRYg.text: Mmm! These pies were so yummy! So cheap too. (Cash only though)  I am going to dream about returning to Edinburgh for these babies!! Both meat and dessert amazed me! We went twice, because on the first visit they didn't have any dessert pies left and I had to try one after I had their delicious beef goodness!

G4BPNU8upkz66tQylMdXaw.text: One of my favorite places in Edinburgh! Prices haven't changed much in the last few years - you can easily fill up for a few pounds. Current ranking of pies I've tried would be: traditional pasty, cottage pie, sausage roll, mac and cheese pie, scotch pie, chili beef. They have dessert pies too, but always seem to be out of them when I visit.

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. sausage roll
Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. hard to choose just one!
Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. cottage pie

TNyFV0aWSy2iUqSlNXY0rQ.text: Okay food at cheap prices.  If you are looking for a quick snack, it will do.

pKUaLkrT-gs4lgBzvFax7g.text: Yummy and affordable breakfast/snack options in Edinburg! The boyfriend and I actually ate a little too much and had to skip dinner. It's a small place with freshly baked personal size pies priced around 2 a piece.  Favs:  1. chicken mushroom pie (flaky pastry and creamy filling) 2. haggis pastry (gotta try haggis when in Scotland. Interesting taste - reminds me of pate and went well with the puff pastry) 3. Mac and cheese pie (definitely get this one)

5k8ybJrWEbJ5GnbTYr2NCQ.text: Went by twice for a take away breakfast pastry. The cheddar and onion pie is spot on. Wish I had gotten two!  Steak and ale pie had good flavor and was served with a crispy top and bottom, but some of the steak was more gristle/fat than meat. Sausage roll was exactly what it should be. All the pastry dough was cooked perfectly...crispy and super flaky. Best for take away as the seating inside is limited and it is very warm in the shop. Wide selection of meat, veggie and other options for a quick bite.

GVpIr1qedbSYsS-uh8HMCg.text: Heard about this place from a coworker, and decided to check it out after reading the reviews on here.I went 4 times during my 11 day trip...  Steak scotch pie was my favorite - was simply large chunks of steak mixed with savory brown gravy inside a pastry shell. Chicken and mushroom pie was a close second, basically just chunks of chicken and mushrooms with creamy white sauce inside puff pastry. Pizza roll is worth checking out also, tastes like a much better version of a hot pocket  They also offer turnovers on the sweet side - I sampled both apple and cherry, and they both blew me away. One of these is also more than enough for two people.  Prices here are dirt cheap, most pies are between 1 - 2.50, and one pie will fill you up. I only regret not being ale to try everything on the menu

9qYkBEfD-T0Kb5qc4Di_Og.text: So good that we ate here twice on our visit! It is CASH ONLY so be prepared.... the savory pies were good! We liked the traditional pasty best---sooooo good! I wasn't really impressed with the mac and cheese pie, but it wasn't bad. The sweet pastries were also really good and really big!

qiW4iylyB4jEjQ2iaSVqEg.text: Oh how can I forget to finish my review! Went to Edinburgh in December  2018 and boy it was freaking cold.  I really wanted to try the meat pies.  I refused to leave the country before actually have meat pies and wished I came here from the start.  Between two of us, we had 3 pies and they were substantial.  We ordered a shepard pie and 2 others that had beef in it.  It was just divine and it was really cheap.  The guy behind the counter was really nice too and he was chatting with the regulars.  He was also patient with us trying to decide what to get because everything looked so good.

-HapE96ovE1NqrwzZWL0sg.text: We do not recommend this place.  I had the steak and ale and scotch pie. Husband had the Mac and cheese pie along with some sort of potato wrapped sausage. Mac and cheese pie was good. Steak and ale was just slightly above average. I did not like the scotch pie. The customer service from the man behind the counter was absolute trash. For whatever reason, I guess I rubbed him the wrong way from the moment I spoke to him. He was utterly rude with every word out of his mouth dripping with animosity. I gave this place three stars because the pie is simply slightly above average. The lack of good customer service and hostility will make sure we don't ever come back.   My husband and I are nice and kind people. If we experience poor customer service, more often than not, we are understanding that some people just have bad days. In this instance, we sat and ate at the window and watched one customer after another come in and was greeted with an entirely different and more kind attitude by the man. For whatever reason, his unwarranted animosity was just geared at us.    Bottom line? We won't come back, that doesn't mean you won't get treated differently. Food is just average.

YmaBUzyw0GQQUwzkp0KgAg.text: Dumb tourist tip: If you're new to Edinburgh and feel that you're standing exactly where that blue dot tells you you're supposed to be, but see NOTHING around that looks right... find some stairs and head up. You're on Cowsgate Road, and at that moment you're standing directly below South Bridge, which is where you actually want to be. I'm just passing that tip along since "a friend" made that mistake! :)   In my week in Edinburgh, I've been to The Piemaker twice. I went with the Scottish and macaroni pies the first time, and they were good - certainly worth the price. Went back for the Vintage Cottage pie and was absolutely blown away. I only have two days left in Edinburgh, but may have to make a third trip to this place.   Doesn't hurt that each pie is generally 2 or less. And, the man who packed up my pies both times was quick and friendly. If I lived in Edinburgh, I'd be here at least once a week. Don't miss it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cottage pie... amazing!

G78pfLgzwtqhzytAvKBs0w.text: Cue the angelic chorus, I am in heaven! These little pies are soooooo delicious, I believe Zeus himself sent them down from Mount Olympus! The people who work here are his muses. There is no other way to explain their divine flavor.  They are very fresh, flaky, and filling. The meats and vegetables inside are tender, and the sauces rich and flavorful. We especially recommend the Chicken and Vegetable, and Steak Scotch pies. The service was fast and friendly. The prices - insanely cheap!  Literally the only downside I can come up with is that the inside is a little small. However, just rethink that as cozy! If I were lucky enough to live in Edinburgh, I would be partaking of this food of the gods ALL the time! And at these prices, I could afford to do so. Cheers!

6QCie1l59o0WsBdWuEzj3w.text: Very basic but tasty meal. A lot of variety and a great stop for a budget traveler. Seating is very limited, bar stools and a small window counter. We had a Shepard's pie, a Scotch pie and another one I can't remember. Each pie was under 2pounds. It's not too far off the royal mile. I'd go back if I was looking for an inexpensive lunch. The stuffed breads looked amazing! Next time!

gzCmknpVlKjEs6InmsToBA.text: Perfect stop for a quick bite when exploring the Royal Mile. Variety of selections, with traditional pies as well as new creative ones like macaroni pie. Traditional, wholesome and fresh baked.

50vvyyS8vt6ikvR7yTf5hw.text: The pies were good. They have a huge variety of different types. I recommend the big steak pastie. The cheese and onion was good as well.

ya2y81LTSryT3wHS12XjQg.text: It's a standard pie shop. It's fine if you're in a rush. I got a steak pie. Pie was good, but cold. The guy behind the counter was an absolute and total prick.

CF6OX2-d-vybwMOAHs8esw.text: The Piemaker is an awesome spot for a good, quick, and cheap meal in Edinburgh. Don't be fooled by their looks either; their pies are delicious and filling.   We were visiting Edinburgh and on the hunt for a cheap and but tasty lunch. The Piemaker is located in downtown Edinburgh but away from the crowds of the castle and Royal Mile. I decided on the classic beef pie and my husband ordered the sausage roll. Our two pies plus two sodas cost us about 3 pounds- super affordable. The pies were absolutely delicious. My beef pie was flavorful with a very flaky crust. Loved it. Great option for tasty and affordable meal!

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Scottish pie

MZhgHNjAW_V8jUuaMhKtag.text: Somewhere between 3-4 stars, because the food is pretty good and the price is right. However, they couldn't answer a basic question of whether there would be more pies available and if we could wait for pies. Traditional Scottish pie had good flavour and was juicy, the sausage roll was forgettable and not that good.  However, it's great for a quick snack, and they are more filling than they look. Perfect to fill you up before you explore the city!

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. traditional pie

Uz0pbFQj0HsPy4WnBupRSA.text: They have diferente pies for you to try. We had about 6 different ones and our favorite was the mushroom and chicken. They were all good and cheap but not anything to write home about.

7A7-3DtNR3edfr-dkV6Ihw.text: Yum yum yum. Mac & cheese pie FTW. I'll have to make that one at home. So good. Steak & Ale pie was proper and the best I had on my trip to the UK.

eGOzhMTnvo_bwDTISd7hqQ.text: Maybe it's me. Maybe I don't understand Scottish pies yet (I'm from the states). Maybe the day was bad and it was rainy and nasty, so it affects things, but overall, I can't say I loved Piemakers.  The restaurant is pretty shabby and beat up. The weather is already bad, and the sky is dark at night. I would out in more effort if I were them.  The food is edible. I got the sausage roll and mozzarella basil roll, and neither were fantastic. Very oily, and the sausage roll had a mushy texture. Perhaps I just don't understand what it should taste like, but I would not eat it again, so it doesn't matter.  All in all, come here if you like a quick cheap bite, probably to go. The guy was nice and offered water, probably bc the place wasn't busy. Just don't expect super fine dining or a place to sit and eat.

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sausage Roll pie
Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mozzarella Basil pie

c2jGbdV2VNXFwb-WlGPJ4w.text: I'll just be over here desperately awaiting the day that handpies become A Thing in NYC. I had the traditional Scottish pasty and it was awesome. Like a meat pot pie but portable. Om nom nom.

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Traditional Scottish

X45QR0aSc7-pSwesnFqmUw.text: Loved this spot! It's a pie shop. They have it down well. We split three pies. Chicken, beef and another. All tasty and fun. Pretty reasonable as well!

If8l41yszjTc5gmtV4Tmiw.text: First off, you walk in and are greeted by a big smile and nice person! The person working was so so nice!   Second, the pie. I got a spinach vergas bake and it was amazing. Huge pie, filled well, warmed up for me, and for 2.50. Filling pie and I really think this place is worth a visit for a good pie in the expensive city of edinburgh!

hXs5rTViqz3n1fT5axfgJw.text: I had the worst experience at this shop. The man working at the counter was incredibly hostile from the moment my friend and I entered the shop. I have been here before and liked the food but would never return because the way they interact with customers here is repulsive. Good pies if you're okay with rude staff.

BEYIGsbbqk7DPPIEnjh8dQ.text: Their steak and ale pie is AMAZING! Also loved the sausage rolls. High recommend this place for a quick bite and it's very inexpensive.

WtWA8zswkB7zTVsRO26uUw.text: These are the best reasonably priced pies around. They are quite large and have a good filling to crust ratio. They also make many different vegetarian options which is a major rarity in this town.  The macaroni and cheese pie is tasty but their spinach pie is divine.

wnBzjxtNJj6bakJN7iNhoQ.text: Quick eats, grab n go savory and sweet pies for cheap. 2 for many of them and each one sizeable and filling. There's minimal seating inside - 6 seats maximum - so be prepared to take your food to go. The quality was good, but it wasn't as unique or delicious as what I had at Pieminister in Oxford.

HVviCCcIO91Qrq8CtWhPCQ.text: Went here multiple times over the course of several days. Their pies are so savory DELICIOUS. No need to go to a sit down restaurant for your daily pie intake, just step into The Piemaker for outstanding takeaway!!  They accept card and there is so seating for eager eaters!  I recommend the cottage pie and the bridie (half circle shaped puff pastry with meaty goodness!). The filling is perfection, meaty gravy goodness with an unbeatable price. It is warm and fresh! I wish I could teleport to Edinburgh just for these. They also have vegetarian pies but I didn't get a chance to try them.   I saw they had a few sweet pies. It would be cool to have an extended sweet pie menu... maybe pumpkin pasties (Harry Potter reference)? I think they would sell very well!!  Thank for you making my tummy happy!

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cottage pie filling... so yummy!!
Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The shop!!

vZqMG2GRqyfCphw-8StRzQ.text: Another place while visiting Edinburgh that Yelp and locals recommended to me. Not a far walk from the castle which was convenient and fast service. The one person working the counter I have to admit wasn't very helpful and didn't offer any help describing the different pies, which was a shame because had we had help I think we would have chosen a better selection.  I had the Mac and cheese pie and the steak pie. Both of them were lukewarm and the Mac and cheese pie was very dry. I did enjoy the steak pie but I just wish it was hot.  The place didn't offer much seating which was also a shame if you're trying to relax and enjoy your meal.

DoaqZaIRU8_qnaAXJLcjgw.text: Fast, fun little shop with a bunch of baked treats, savory and or sweet,  to slip in and grab a bite. Nothing fancy but who honestly cares.

NuCvoi-1c4ZGwSCRtqZUZQ.text: Came here after we couldn't stomach another place. Best decision of the night. Very tasty and the price couldn't be beat $2.30 pounds.

NW67Y5S7GYK2BwYChai6ig.text: I love me some pies. I think one of my favourite foods in general is mini, savoury pies.   I got the flaky haggis, the steak, and the mac and cheese!  My favourite was the haggis, then mac and cheese, and last the steak. They were all so delicious though. Warm, tasty, and filling.   You can pay by card but only over a certain amount.  Montreal equivalent: Ta Pies!

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

cmAHvt7pCBme0QF1yDJrtg.text: Eh... Ok, nothing great. I will say you can feed two people for lunch for less than 10. Also, they won't let you use your bank card on purchases less than 3. Which is understandable but also against Visa policy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sausage roll. Basically a hot dog in dry pastry. Nothing special.

HBIrdLVaGLRGZaJOaSNkAw.text: They have a wide variety of light meals, that will fill you up but not load you down the rest of the day. And you can find a lot of traditional Scottish food here. I had a bridie, a hand-held, ground beef pie, and Irn Bru, for the first time. (I heard many other Americans say that it tastes like cream soda. It's close but a lot more sweeter.) Great place for lunch, whether to eat there or take it with you.

PfoNiVoJ3uW1LIMyGS3G8A.text: Great place to stop in for a quite bit, delicious pies!! We stopped here for a couple pies between pubs

x0mVgHXQa5-cqaUzU87h4g.text: Love this place. A definite highlight and a gem of Edinburgh! It was so good, I made a trip back just to go there before I left just to make sure it was the pies and not my emotions of love.  the original scotch pie and the steak scotch pie was Soo good. Crispy thin pie crust, not mushy; tender flavorful meat filling. Fluffy pie pastry on top. It's one of those places you just detour for, and makes you want to go back.  Please try this and tell me what you think! I hope this persuades you!

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Original scotch pie, beef, beef fat, spicess.

ATE7Roqaw5yoTa1cKrd17A.text: LOVED my haggis pie and my Scottish steak pie. They had so many different ones, I was sad I wasn't more hungry! They keep them hot under a lamp, so they're ready to eat right when they hand it to you. I really wish I could go back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. One half of each a Scottish steak pie and a haggis pie

iBa2l5GWHo0ozsCMDoFfQg.text: The pies are delicious and prices are friendly. We tried haggis pie, scottish pie, meat and ale pie, pasties and mac and ceese pie and they were all delish! My fave was te steak and ale & mac n cheese ones.... the place is tiny and there were only about 8 stools by the windows to sit and eat there...cashier wasnt too friendly but it didnt bither me much. Overall a good place to try savoury pies

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Our dinner

A-06YcVPekWd82KFTbxDmg.text: So many pies to choose from! Unlike American Pies, these were of the savory sort and delicious flaky hand-helds. We tried a few - beef, mac n cheese, and a curry one. They were really good, but a tad dried out from sitting under the heat lamp. The staff member there that day wasn't overly friendly or helpful, but the food was good and cheap! I'd visit this hand held pie shop again!

608TSUZ1KHFfXB5LsDkhzw.text: Food was average, place is small, however it is cheap! Employee was not the most friendly worker. Doesn't explain that food is out. Just looks at you as you ask for the food and says "uh no that's not there"

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Food is warm and decent. Employee pictured is not the most friendly individual. Food goes quick and takes a bit to come back into stock.

GFmVh6v69525kLKwnVQ4lQ.text: Admittedly, I stumbled upon this place accidentally as I was wandering around Edinburgh looking for a place to eat that was open and wasn't on the royal mile. I walked in with no expectations, but I'm definitely glad I tried it.  The various pies are the things to get and I ended up getting the meat pie. Simple, cost-effective ($1.10?), and tasty. Honestly, it felt like chicken pot pie meets asian dumplings. It has the consistency of a baked pastry on the inside with a sort of meat ball on the inside.   I was pleasantly surprised by this place once I checked it up on Yelp afterwards. This is good for a quick snack or a meal!

yjsLZzRqWCgTC352uqAfug.text: I had read the positive Yelp reviews and was excited to try the pies, however, the food was quite unimpressive.  The pies were dry and taste as if they have been sitting out for hours. Wasn't sure if they just heated up some frozen pies from Sainsbury's across the street!  Shortbread is lacking in flavor.   In addition, the service is extremely poor. The man behind the counter was condescending and rude. Horrible attitude! With the service and below average food, I would not recommend to anyone - although it's cheap, save yourself the disappointment!

Smzozcw1Baj5nmCDFgHiTw.text: Sure the food is fine but the service and the attitude of the people behind the counter were downright offensive. Because the pies in the case were mislabeled we ordered something that was not actually available and were told we were stupid for not realizing that the pie didn't match the label, we ordered an apple tart and received a mocking retort when we asked it it was possible to warm it, and when we didn't hit the credit card minimum for our order (there was no indication there was a minimum) and asked what we could add to charge the extra pound we were told to look at the prices in the case ourselves. We wish we had read the other reviews warning us about the terrible temperament of the store owner/employees before coming in because no matter how good the food was it's no excuse for purposefully being rude to customers.

vU3LS_OKeE0Om-ok5x5d9w.text: Excessive and unnecessary rudeness by the cashier behind the counter. He is photographed in another review, and his offensive behavior is mentioned in several other reviews. Because of him, will not be returning to this restaurant and cannot recommend. Food is cheap, but life is too precious to be wasted dealing with miserable people like him.

p086hCJ3ELXOfRvHrz37mg.text: Great food and even better prices!! Came 2 days in a row for lunch. Have all kinds of pies and sausage rolls, among other pastries! Seriously cannot best the price. 2 pies and 2 sausage rolls for 5!

tB3_jogtMUr5v1rT0oWbyQ.text: Wow...what a terrible, terrible experience. We walked in here for lunch after having gotten coffee at Starbucks. After we paid for our food here (for takeaway), the guy behind the counter told us we couldn't have coffee in there. That's fine...I understand eating establishments not wanting you to bring in outside food. We hadn't intended to stay, but my partner went to throw her coffee cup away anyways out of respect for them. The guy then told her she wasn't allowed to throw away her cup in there. She wasn't going to protest, even though that was odd, but he went on to insult her anyways. He starting talking about how they hate Starbucks and anyone who goes to Starbucks. He said apparently we love Starbucks, so we supported all the awful things the coffee shop apparently does. We've never been treated so rudely, especially after just having paid someone. We said we'd wished we'd known he was going to treat us that way before we paid him and he simply said, "well now you know." Disgusting service. I don't care how he feels about Starbucks, but we are not Starbucks. We're paying customers. I suggest taking your business elsewhere and not supporting such an awful establishment. I only hope he doesn't represent the rest of the staff. Truly disgusting service.

84itun6pvcjpIXDSs5_D7g.text: Delicious little pies, inexpensive and small meant to try several as a smorgasbord of pie offerings....found the few I sampled to all be tasty on their own merits....highly suggest trying a couple for lunch in Edinburgh!

BYbAF202dMjIXBtJ7vVS_g.text: The Scotch Pie for 1 pound was delicious (peppery meat)!! I can't believe it's so cheap since it's sooooo good-a good size with juicy peppery meat!  The 75p bridie was alright and haggis scotch pie was not bad.

wR7XpSg_9WBzaGrrYME4Vw.text: Hubby is a bigger fan cos he likes the pepper steak pies but I can wolf down a chicken and mushroom pie quicker than the Polish lady can say "Will I make warm for you?"  Piemaker kicks Greggs' arse because...guess what, their pies actually have MEAT in them!

jdeYy5EOSpQ8FnVmI8IKlA.text: Good value pasties - Haggis rolls, scotch pies and Bridies to name a few. The Brides were only 90pence yesterday, really good value. Forget the fast food chains and get something you will remember about a trip to Auld Reekie, this is a good place.

5Z78ufajnYhX-Xt7dTPKEg.text: I need to go back here for more pies! A tiny place on Southbridge with a large selection of hot pies. I had the chicken curry which fell apart because it was so hot and I couldn't handle it. Ended up eating it with a fork which was ok because it was filled with so many goodies. Need to go back and try something else. Small amount of seating but it turns over pretty quickly.

-tv8rHDCHcL5QCq9mHNnYA.text: Legent. There is no pie at the Pie Maker's that I wouldnt like. Somebody has already mentioned the legendary Tatty Dog. I believe that it deserves it's own paragraf full of smiling faces of people that just have had one. The prices are very reasonable. The staff is super nice. Pies are always fresh and crispy. There is wide selection of pies so you can go a bit wild each day of the week ordering a different pie. They are original and classic. There is something savoury and sweet.  I go there at least once a week with my Regular Customer's Card which is a GREAT deal. After spending 10 ponds on the card you get a pie, dring and a cookie for free!!! I love Pie Maker's.

DacM8T7dB4p4RAaoMNwcJg.text: Awesome place to get really good, really cheap pies. I lived in a flat above this place and ate here all the time as a result.

BM5Ie2VY7bFlQGVKFIBDLA.text: Great if you want to grab a quick bite to eat, nice veggie options too!

MnZDRFXtMI7NCc-B0PQSlg.text: Magical, flakey, perfect vegetarian and vegan pies. Especially fond of the cheese sticks.

pbIQ8TrNffgWwnCns0mZwA.text: Pie maker is like an upmarket Greggs the bakers. It sells a massive selection of pasties, pies, sandwiches and soup and is perfect for a lunch on the go. The pasties are really inventive- thai vegetable pasty, lasagne pies, cheese and spinach pasty and veggie haggis rolls to name a few The best thing about piemaker is it is exceptionally cheap. The pastries are big, and the fillings are chunky (no rubbish puree here!). They are hearty and wholesome and are amazing hangover food. Not exactly healthy, but there is soup available for those who dont feel the need for pastry and pies. Piemaker is open late (till about 2am at the weekend), so it also makes a nice post-pub snack. Yum!

si7ITnKR-iXCXFSbTvjUYw.text: I first went to the Piemaker in '05, when visiting my girlfriend on her year abroad in Scotland. I've been waiting ever since to go back. Thankfully, in 2010, it's just as good as I remember. Small shop, plenty of options, all delicious. Seriously, the food here is awesome. I'm a big favorite of the chicken tikka pie. My brothers were all turned onto the delicious wonder that is these pies. If you're in Edinburgh, you cannot leave before going here.

-jnBYR4SLl1gc0LVyrRftw.text: When I was living in Edinburgh I ate here on a weekly basis. Beautiful, fresh pies that are wonderfully priced and very filling! They also have really great donuts and a few other types of sweets.

3Gu3RDac4dOTCWkaxkmZaQ.text: For those cold afternoons where you simply need something toasty to fill the hole in your belly, The Piemaker offers a nice range of pies, pasties, pastries and other baked goods. While not being at all extravagant, this is good fare for a cheap price that comes greasy, piping hot and is guaranteed to satisfy.

DHclObCY7Amw4BmK2A_BMg.text: Best haggis pie in Scotland! And amazingly friendly staff, all for a couple of pounds. If your traveling through Edinburgh you shouldn't miss this one!

rvSySFt5Yz4xoBS3pWeznQ.text: The Pie Maker is a versatile establishment, changing from a great place to grab a quick and tasty lunch to one of the few places to stumble into after a night out and eat whatever you can afford with the spare change you haven't drunk A great feature are the bar stools at the window facing west, overlooking Southbridge, as sitting here seems to capture any hint of sunshine that breaks through the everlasting winter clouds of Edinburgh. While the products on offer are not the most subtle or sophisticated fare on offer on Southbridge, they are cheap, and are no Greggs!

BDLZ5NGTMLcAMSVSvUw9dw.text: If sweeney todd were alive today, his meat products would probably end up being peddled by the Piemaker. The Piemaker, is a concept take away which sells all things pies to passing revelers. This sounds a fantastically idea, but the selection is wide and the need for pre baking means pies can be dry. If you can be sure of a fresh one, this place is well worth a look. Do not use in place of actual meal.

kOI-ryop8IQjcOHjZDwueQ.text: I'm always in Edinburgh during the Fringe performing at C Venues down the street and I literally eat Piemaker every day for an entire month.  The daily special Samosas (for only a pound!) are enough to keep me full for hours and they are sooo delicious.  and a big thumbs up to the jelly/cream donuts and the mushroom roll things.    can't wait to be in the city again so I can get my samosa fix :)

IWkZpnwcGBMI3Br3rBYYNQ.text: The place in Edinburgh that comes closest to an Aussie pie shop. No Ned Kelly pie though.

9VhLmBLPPGYnye70VjrXqg.text: Firstly, I have to mention my hysterical laughing at the sign above Piemakers door - "Pies so fresh they'll pince yer bum and call yer darlin'". Yes indeed, I dont know why, but that got to me.  And really, the feeling of euphoria afterwards didn't deminish - i was throughly impressed by Piemaker - I was expecting it to be a but scruffy, and generally a bit on the less savory side of things, but I was wrong.  This place is no Simple Simon the Pieman, the pies are all freshly made, delicious and actually have a decent filling in them - unlike some other chain store places. Staff are a bit grumpy, but for how much you talk to them, its not really a problem.  I really liked this place, and while Im not generally a pie kind of person, I did enjoy what I ate, and next time I need a pastry infuion, I will be heading here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

_xu6AjnkfrZa7VEWt8OAIg.text: Have been going to Piemaker for a good few years but to be honest I don't really know why. Ok, on the positive side they have probably the broadest range of pies in Edinburgh and are of a good size, reasonably priced with reasonably priced cakes and muffins of a decent size too.  The negatives, I've never had a fresh pie out of the oven from here, it's always been lukewarm (I don't want it warmed up in the microwave that ruins the pastry!).  I usually go for the chunky vegetable with tastes a bit bland and sort of like a chunky cup a soup  in a pie, (also the pastry is really thick and doughy.) Also I had an absoloutely terrible vegetable soup from here which had  overcooked vegetables and soup that reminded me of the soup I used to get for free out of the vending machine at work. So, yeah why do I keep going? Not sure. Probably because it's conveniently located, and you get a decent amount of food for not a huge amount of money and you can sit in. However, it could be so much more. They seem to concentrate too much on having a large range of pies rather than on quality.  By far the best meat pies I've had recently have come from humble, local butchers. Just decent solid, meat filled pasties, bridies, nothing fancy, no 'moroccan vegetables' Or Cajun chicken's, just well seasoned, well filled pies. It's not rocket science surely. Quality ingredients, simply cooked = good pies, simples!  But I'll probably be back, because you can't sit in in greggs.  I've given it 3 stars, but  would have given 2.5 if I could.

dCHmAtE2P5MvLLLz3azXQg.text: Best for student budgets. Solid steak pasty and chicken pie. I liked the macaroni and cheese pie for 1. Small selections of dessert pies. Sausage roll was not my favorite.

W1q3IgBxARpP2kMjCLwIhw.text: Sometimes you just need some greasy meat pies. This is the place to get them.

HveWykd-QY-Mw2pTKQVSiA.text: Came here on my husband's birthday for lunch. Yes, birthday lunch at the Pie Maker. We had never been and walked past it many times so we finally decided to stop by after all the great Yelp reviews. We were not disappointed!   The place was packed as it was lunch on a weekday and it is near Uni so we got our delicious pies to go. We are vegetarian and, at first, I was afraid they wouldn't have much of a selection for veggies but I was surprised to see they did - much to our delight!  We ordered the Mexican veggie, Thai curry veggie, and one that tasted like a chicken pot pie but with no chicken.   We thought 3 would be enough and we were wrong - it was way more than enough! We got them to go and went over to the museum and ate our delicious pies on benches while staring at beautiful pieces of art. We only ate 2 of the 3 pies because they were so filling and saved the other one for later.   Great prices that can't be beat! 3 pies for less than a fiver!

pF3OGd650YXnybad-htwZQ.text: Nice ham roll. Very tasty. It's very convenient to take away and the price is satisfied.

phF8gWpA8Gagy1YRFlheCQ.text: Great pies but place needs some sprucing up and I'm not sure the staff was dressed properly to be around so much exposed food. Their was hair was not tied back and it flying all over the place. Also, count your change before you leave. My change was not only pounds, I was given euros too. I sure this is not legal and I'm  not sure if they do this often. Besides that the chicken mushrooms pie was great and flakey.

TCXCF8MxmYMonZ3YS34IZw.text: We were looking for something quick and authentic. The Piemaker had a constant stream of traffic and seemed to be popular with the locals.   We tried a variety of meat pies. Nothing fancy but quite delicious. My son raved about the Tattidog - a hot dog wrapped in mashed potatoes and deep fried.

v6INJbG8mQC6xL4IeZRKVw.text: Piemaker is just around the corner from my festival job, which makes it ideal for those scarce moments of freedom where I can go get food.  They have a good selection of pies including steak bakes, Mexican vegetable, spinach and cheese, and the list goes on. It is pretty cheap which is great for the very small Festival wage I am on.  Piemaker would get an extra star if it wasn't for the permanent stink face of the young, Eastern European girl who works in there. I had to restrain myself from telling her that a please/thank you goes a long long way and if she hated people so much then she should get another job. The rest of the staff are lovely, just watch out for stink face.

AD3ODTfE5UGI9Pr57jzlzQ.text: Pie Maker - as the scale says 'As good as it gets'  I recently completed a two week stint at the Edinburgh Festival. After every single performance at 1pm i would head down to Pie Maker for cheap, satisfying and tasty lunch time sustenance. It is brilliant! An actors dream. Pies are handheld, very filling and can range from 85p to about 2. My lunch in London comes to about 5 daily for similar qualities!  The range of pies they do to is fantastic. Everything from your classics such as steak and ale, cottage to Balti pies, as well as more sweet pastries. All are made fresh in store as well and very nutritious. The Haggis Pie was quite the stand out for me.  Not only that, Pie Maker do great deals - for instance 'Spend over 2 and get a free donut'!  The staff are brilliant and remember you from day to day (something you could never expect in London)  THE PASTRY IS BLOODY INCREDIBLE!  Pie Maker was a staple part of my Edinburgh Festival and helped make up one of the best experiences of my life.  I am so enfused by them that i am going to offer to build a website for them for free (which they so sorely need!)  People must know about the best pies in Scotland!

B7wIj2x5BKihi_U7Yo0KAQ.text: God I loved this place when I visited Edinburgh. I was a poor traveler who had to watch her pennies. I got the best bang for my buck here. Wish they had a store in New York City; so it goes.

photos.caption: Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Steak Pie
Photo of The Piemaker - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

DHppIKOS-ZPJ2iDXAls0og.text: Wow. Everything I had here was quite delicious. Pepper steak was seasoned really well and the crust/bread thing was crispy. Also ordered a sausage roll wrapped with potato. That was pretty good, but ketchup definitely helped with it. Apple turnover was definitely a winner for me! On top of that, it was awesome to eat a really tasty and CHEAP meal.

65ZJoPveO4mmmzNrxHjBKA.text: Went here on the recommendation of a friend who knows my partner's love of pies.  Said partner was in seventh heaven - if it can go in a pie, it goes in a pie in this place. We tried lasagne pies - which are pretty much exactly what you would expect. The discovery of the trip was the 'Tattidog', though - not for the faint hearted - it's sausage, wrapped in fried potato, and probably consists of about 80% grease. Delicious.   This is not fine dining, but it is perfect for when you're dashing about from one thing to another, and need something stodgy to keep you going.

4_ZriLihothOlufM6zoY-Q.text: We all have defining moments in our life. For some it's biting the umbilical cord of their first born, then gobbling down the placenta Tom Cruise style. For a more reserved chap such as myself, I'll stick down my discovery of Piemaker on the list of "greatest ever."  Even though it's scruffy, cheap, and with staff just the wrong side of miserable, any negatives are forgotten as soon as you get your mitts on any the goods. Piemaker takes baked savouries to levels you couldn't imagine, with their sausage rolls in particular a joy to behold.  The baguettes are delicious and made with proper meat, and I won't even try and explain the giant apple turnover, it's exactly as perfect as it sounds. It's not even much dearer than Greggs.  Fantastic.

rEM5d0sTn_8aaB7RffOrrQ.text: Great selection of savory and sweet pies!

cjKB4Su1SCfJ84sCuZGUdg.text: While I don't quite share Gavin's enthusiasm that Piemaker is the best thing since sliced bread, I do agree that they do a killer sausage roll and I've been known to eat quite a few.  I mean, I can't complain really... who doesn't like a good pie? Especially on a cold, winters day when the piping hot filling warms the cockles of your heart.   There's a good range of goodies all very reasonable priced and if you're after a light bite for lunch then Piemaker is perfect!

uGxrwWwZjrP2yjBpr07Ljw.text: The Piemaker boasts that it's sausage rolls maintain the old miners tradition of rolling the peppery sausage meat in two layers of pastry.  Double pastry?!?!?! Too perfect.

6qjymKdgs_cQUhlVCYhcbg.text: Oi does loike a good pie oi does. But it's pretty difficult up in Edinburgh unless you want to spend loads getting pub food, or going to the carbon copy bakeries - Greggs etc. Problem solved. Piemaker, just next to Frankenstein's is a great little pie shop. The pastry is good and fluffy, not like that sad stuff that just folds in on itself that you can often get. And the best part is that they use real meat, not just chewy dog food which I'm sure I've had many times before.  There are both savoury and sweet pies, but my personal favourites have to be the sausage rolls. Wrapped in a double layer of pastry and seasoned with a good level of spicy pepperiness, they are the best around. As they are open late as well, you have another alternative to pizza paradise when walking back from a night out. Especially good on a cold Edinburgh winter night, when the beer jacket doesn't quite cut it

vkm3jVfJJs2wSA-hgcu-ww.text: Serves many of the same items as Gregg's Bakery- pies, sandwiches, sausage rolls etc but rather than the horrible greasy after taste of Gregg's the food here actually uses real ingredients rather than fat and cardboard.  Piemaker also has the bonus of being open til 2am and is a great alternative to kebabs or chips  as you stumble home -no healthier I agree, but at least its more original!  Most people go for the takeaway option here but there are a few high tables and stools which are a good place to perch and watch the world go by on Nicholson Street as you tuck into a yummy pie!

xhqhyzwOASCvWuMjFWFTDQ.text: Cheap, Cheerful and Delicious. Got a "Tattidog" to see what the fuss was about and it delivered. Just wish I stocked up on a few more pies for the dinner - ah well.
